intro: Radicula nasturtium, commonly known as the common nasturtium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Tropaeolaceae. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of orange, yellow, and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its roots are fibrous and help anchor the plant in well-drained soil. Radicula nasturtium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible flowers, which have a peppery taste.
